name: ANTI-DISCRIMINATION CENTER BRUSSELS
membership: Member of the International Federation for Human Rights (FIDH)
goal: The Anti-Discrimination Center Memorial Brussels is an organization that fights against all form of discrimination in post-soviet countries. ADC "Memorial" wants to defend the rights of minorities and vulnerable groups and oppose racism, sexism, homophobia and all other forms of xenophobia in post-soviet countries. ADC "Memorial" uses a large number of tools to raise awareness of discrimination among the general public and authorities and to fight discrimination: reporting, advocacy, legal cases, campaigns.
interests: Enlargement, External Relations, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Regional Policy
euInitiatives: Justice and fondamental rights, European Foreign Policy, Enlargement Policy, European integration Policy, Development Policy
